Notes1: RELA (p65) is known to exhibit positive autoregulation, sustaining its own expression once active.
The condition prevents re-triggering when the active complex is already formed.
IKK complex activates RELA by phosphorylating IκBα.The activation of RELA by IKK has been supported by immunohistochemistry evidence.
RELA can transcriptionally activate NFKB1, which encodes the p105 precursor of p50. The induction of NFKB1 expression by RELA has been supported by RT-PCR experiments.

The NF-κB complex, particularly the RELA:p50 heterodimer, forms when both subunits are present in the nucleus. This interaction is well-characterized structurally and functionally.The complex formation is supported by crystal structure evidence.

The NF-κB complex, particularly the RELA:p50 heterodimer, forms when both subunits are present in the nucleus. This interaction is well-characterized structurally and functionally. The complex formation is supported by crystal structure evidence.
In this simplified model, the IKK complex is considered an external input or persistently active in response to stimuli like TNF-α or LPS.
IL6 expression is induced by the active NF-κB complex, which serves as an inflammatory cytokine.
